# Who am I?

  • I live in Glendale, Wisconsin.
    • It is a subburb of Milwaukee.
    • Glendale is a lovely place to live.
  • I am a habitual hobby collector (photography, ukulele, lock picking, etc).
  • I have two dogs and a cat.
  • I enjoy international travel.
    • I enjoy travel hacking, too (it is how I afford the trip).
    • I am planning to visit Italy in 2022.
  • I am a web application developer.
    • I have worked for Bader Rutter since July 2021.
      • BR clients include Zoetis, Corteva Agriscience, PhytoGen cottonseed, and Brevant seeds
    • I previously worked for QM Quality Matters, Starkmedia, Experis, and UWM.
    • I have written a lot of ColdFusion since 2006.
      • I do not recommend that anybody install Adobe ColdFusion when Lucee is available.
      • I don't really do ColdFusion anymore.
    • These days (at work) I use:
      • Vue.JS
      • Nuxt
      • Marketo
      • Pitcher
    • When I write code for fun, I mainly use:
      • Vue.JS
      • VuePress (what this site uses)
      • Bulma (I had issues with Bootstrap previously)
      • WordPress
      • Google Cloud Platform
    • I tend to enjoy front-end development more than back-end development.
  • In 2005, I recieved a BBA in Management Information Systems from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee - Lubar School of Business.
  • In 2012, I recieved a MBA from Cardinal Stritch University.
  • Conferences that I will be at in 2022:
    • Cyphercon 5.3
    • That Conference (Hopefully, if I can manage it)
  • I post to my blog fairly often.
    • It tends to be 80% coding topics and 20% other topics.
    • Posts go up on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
  • I am a Lord under the house of Pierpont-Archer per LordJosephSteinbringCertificate.pdf, I guess.
  • If you want to send me money for something, you can use: https://paypal.me/joesteinbring
  • I have another website at jws.app.
  • When I post something on Instagram, I try to also post the same thing on the Photo Blog.
  • I have a travel tumblr for random travel photos. It has it's own twitter feed.

# About this site

This website (jws.dev) was hosted on Keybase but is now hosted on Render. This site uses VuePress (a Vue-powered static site generator) and uses no tracking code or cookies. The source code is available on github.
